title: FP&A ANALYST
description:
This role offers an excellent opportunity to combine analytical expertise with business partnership. You’ll collaborate closely with Sales, S\\&OP, and Product Management to support key financial decisions, drive performance, and contribute to strategic planning. It’s a position that provides both visibility and influence, allowing you to develop your financial acumen and make a tangible impact on business results.

**Job Requirements**
--------------------


* Analysing economic trends, historical performance and identifying key actionable areas; preparing monthly/quarterly/yearly finance forecasts; ensuring accuracy in financial results and reports.
* Monitor financial performance and provide regular reporting on variances from budget, highlighting risks and opportunities
* Prepare ad\\-hoc financial models and analysis to support business decisions and strategic initiatives
* Providing key insights to management on strategic and operational decisions through clear and succinct oral and written communications.
* Coaching and developing junior financial planning analysts; reviewing their work whenever needed.
* Support with Integration activities such as synergy reporting and scorecard updating.
* Performing profitability analysis by product and the segment, margin analysis, and supports with the sales validation.
* Preparing the monthly, quarterly and annual financial targets through analysing sales data, preparing reports, and communicating it to multiple stakeholders
* Tracking key performance indicators, following up on critical items, and collaborating with multiple stakeholders to ensure that the sales and product management team meet the financial targets.
* Reviewing product pricing and rebate agreements, supporting business decisions, and ensuring teams make decisions that drive profitable growth.
* Conducting audits on financial data and analysis reports, budgets, and forecasts and ensuring that the document follows the organization's policies and complies with the required standards.
* Support PM team to analyse standard costs and help to identify opportunities for cost reduction.
**What your background should look like**
-----------------------------------------


* Bachelor’s degree in finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field; CFA/CPA/MBA/ Master’s degree or local equivalent is a plus
* Minimum of 6\\-8 years of experience.
* Strong understanding of financial planning, budgeting, and forecasting processes
* Advanced Excel and financial modelling skills; proficiency in ERP systems (SAP, Oracle HFM, etc.) and financial software (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) is a plus
* Strong business acumen with the ability to identify and capitalize on commercial opportunities
* Excellent communication and presentation skills,
* Experience in driving process improvements
* Ability to work independently, manage multiple priorities, and meet deadlines in a fast\\-paced environment.

  


**Please submit your resume in English. Thank you!**

  




\\#jobsEMEAEH



\\#LI\\-HYBRID

**ABOUT TE CONNECTIVITY**  

TE Connectivity plc (NYSE: TEL) is a global industrial technology leader creating a safer, sustainable, productive, and connected future. Our broad range of connectivity and sensor solutions enable the distribution of power, signal and data to advance next\\-generation transportation, energy networks, automated factories, data centers, medical technology and more. title: Controlling Specialist
description:
**À propos de l’offre d’emploi** 




  





 COFICAB is a global leader in the design, manufacturing, and sales of wires and cables, mainly for the Automotive industry. The company is a member of the Tunisian multinational industrial group, ELLOUMI Group, founded in 1946\\.
 



  





 COFICAB Group’s footprint expands over 4 continents, 14 countries, 17 state\\-of\\-the\\-art industrial sites, 4 R\\&D centers of Excellence, and 14 Sales Offices Worldwide. With advanced business capabilities and a team of 8500 employees, the group supplies major players in the automotive industry.
 



  





 COFICAB maintains its commitment to sustainability\\-driven growth and innovation, with the aim to leave a better world to the next generations.
 



  





 As we continue to expand our global footprint to get closer to our clients and reduce supply chain, we also keep improving the sustainability of our operations, to reduce our carbon footprint.
 



  





 On top of being a worldwide leader in the automotive megatrends Sustainability, E\\-Mobility, Connectivity, and Autonomous Driving, COFICAB also conquered new markets in the appliance, medical, and distribution sectors. We approach new markets with the same compromise of working closely with our clients on their specific needs and shaping a better tomorrow together.
 



  





 COFICAB has emphasized its role as a socially responsible company, ensuring it contributes to the well\\-being of the communities where it is present and its commitment to sustainability. A story to which we want to keep adding new and successful chapters.
 



  





 In Morocco, we are present in two cities, Tangier and Kenitra with four production units and one Advanced delivery Center, distributing products throughout the entire country and beyond.
 



 COFICAB Morocco provides over 1000 employees with a nurturing work environment and promotes environmental and social development through a variety of CSR initiatives.
 



  





 COFICAB is hiring
 **Controlling** 
**Specialist** 




  





**Job purpose :** 




 Calculates and monitors overall plant industrial and financial performance results and provides management with reliable, accurate, and timely performance indicators and business analysis required for the decision\\-making process. Leads plant budget and costing development and controls budget utilization and deployment in order to meet plant objectives in line with corporate strategy.
 



  





**Main responsibilities :** 




  




* Develops and implements business reporting procedures including reporting timetable and defines key business measures for performance monitoring. Checks regularly and monitors data accuracy for key business performance indicators to ensure its integrity and effectiveness.
* Calculates, communicates, and monitors benchmarking performance indicators and prepares regular and ad\\-hoc management reporting on plant overall performance.
* Contributes to the development of budget management procedures in line with corporate strategy and policy. Support the plant departments in the preparation of their budgets by providing appropriate information and predefined budget targets. Coordinates and follows up on budget consolidation and approval process.
* Monitors plant budget realization rate and expenses reporting. Identifies potential deviation, analyses root causes and assesses the impact on the plant performance. Develops and maintains cost calculation methods and monitors plant cost results against predefined targets.
* Performs monthly inventory count and valorization of materials, semi\\-finished goods, finished goods, and scrap in the plant according to inventory count procedure. Analyses inventory potential deviation, propose appropriate corrective actions, and communicates inventory counts result in reports.



  





**Educational Background:** 




 Master's degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, Data Analyst
 



  





**Required Experience :** 




 \\- 1\\-3 years in a similar position
 



  





**Functional and Technical Competencies :** 




 Cost accounting, Budgeting, Accounting (principles and practices), Tax procedures, Business planning, wire production processes (awareness), Internal controls system, Analytical and problem\\-solving skills, Financial data analysis, Reporting Skills, Risk Management, and Organizational skills.
 



  





 A good level of French \\& English is mandatory
 



  





**Location:** 
 Tangier , Morocco
 



**Hiring Manager:** 
 AJNAOU Oumaima

title: QA Engineer
description:
APM Terminals
### **Role Overview**

As a QA Engineer at TM2, you will ensure the integrity, performance, and reliability of terminal automation and IT systems. You will design, execute, and maintain complex testing and emulation environments covering the full Operational Technology landscape from equipment\\-level automation to application\\-level business processes . This role demands deep technical competence, strong ownership, and the ability to deliver under operational pressure in a live terminal environment.
### **Key Responsibilities**

Testing \\& Validation
* Design, configure, and maintain testing and emulation environments replicating real terminal operations.
* Execute end\\-to\\-end test procedures on standalone and integrated automation systems, including cranes, gates, and yard equipment.
* Conduct system\\-level validation across the OT stack: from equipment control logic to business process automation in the application layer.
* Ensure all testing activities strictly follow QA processes, safety standards, and operational protocols.
* Validate that automation, control, and IT systems meet both functional and operational requirements prior to production.
* Run complex simulations in collaboration with Automation, M\\&R, IT, and Operations teams to ensure readiness for production rollout.

Defect Management \\& Documentation
* Lead defect identification, logging, tracking, and closure throughout the QA lifecycle.
* Produce high\\-quality documentation of test cases, execution results, and corrective actions aligned with internal QA standards.
* Drive root\\-cause analysis and implement sustainable corrective and preventive actions for systemic issues.
* Ensure full traceability between test coverage, defect history, and operational outcomes.

Stakeholder Collaboration \\& Rollout Support
* Act as QA focal point with Automation, IT, and Operations stakeholders for all testing and go\\-live activities.
* Execute stakeholder\\-requested test scenarios and provide structured, data\\-driven feedback on operational readiness.
* Support technical discussions with external vendors and system integrators , ensuring deliverables meet TM2’s quality and reliability standards.

Safety \\& Compliance
* Comply with all company safety procedures and immediately report unsafe acts or conditions.
* Maintain accurate, up\\-to\\-date QA documentation in line with internal quality standards and audit requirements.

### **Qualifications \\& Experience**

Education
* Master's degree in computer science, Automation, Software Engineering, or a directly related field.

Experience \\& Technical Skills
Candidates must demonstrate solid, hands\\-on experience in all of the following areas :
* Design and maintenance of testing and emulation environments for integrated automation systems.
* Automation systems and industrial IT integration, including API/REST/SOA interfaces and event\\-driven architectures.
* System and process validation in environments combining software, hardware, and real\\-time control.
* Testing methodologies, QA frameworks, and software lifecycle management applied to industrial or automation contexts.
* Simulation and test automation tools, including configuration and execution of automated test cycles.
* Technical documentation, test case creation, and structured defect tracking using professional QA tools.
* Collaboration with suppliers, vendors, and cross\\-functional teams in large\\-scale automation projects.
* Proven ability to work effectively in a diverse and technical environment.
* Strong organizational and analytical skills with a precise, methodical approach to testing and reporting.

### **Key Competencies**

* Excellent communication and collaboration skills (English proficiency required).
* Analytical and structured thinking applied to complex technical systems.
* Proactive commitment to safety, quality, and continuous improvement.
* Ability to manage multiple priorities under operational constraints.
* Ownership mindset, attention to detail, and results\\-driven approach.

Maersk is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we embrace different styles of thinking. Maersk is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applicants without regard to race, colour, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy or parental leave, veteran status, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.  



We are happy to support your need for any adjustments during the application and hiring process. If you need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website, apply for a position, or to perform a job, please contact us by emailing accommodationrequests@maersk.com .

title: Field Ingineer (Inspection of Ancillary Facilities) (Electrical/civil)
description:
**We’re Hiring: Field Engineer Electrical /civil – Inspection of Ancillary Facilities**  
**Location: Tangier, Morocco**

**About the Role:**  
We are seeking a dedicated **Field Technician** to inspect and maintain ancillary facilities within our wind farm. The successful candidate will play a key role in ensuring the smooth operation and safety of infrastructure beyond the wind turbines.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Inspect operation and maintenance service items stipulated in the contract, excluding wind turbines.
* Conduct routine inspections and repairs of roads and 33kV cable lines.
* Monitor drainage systems and ancillary facilities such as box\\-type transformers within the wind farm area.
* Record abnormal conditions, assist in developing maintenance plans, and participate in handling simple faults.
* Collaborate with the maintenance team to complete planned tasks, including preventive maintenance and special inspections during the rainy season.
* Organize and submit inspection reports to ensure data accuracy and completeness.

**Qualifications:**

* **Education:** Secondary vocational school degree or above in **Electrical, Civil, Mechanical Engineering**, or related fields.
* **Experience:** Minimum 2 years in inspection and maintenance of wind farms or similar industrial sites. Familiarity with ancillary facilities such as roads, cable lines, and drainage systems is required.
* **Certifications (preferred):** Basic safety certifications for high\\-altitude work, electrician operations, cable inspection, road maintenance, or construction machinery operation.
* **Language Skills:** Fluent in French or Arabic for daily tasks. Basic English reading and writing skills are a plus.

**Skills \\& Abilities:**

* **Technical Expertise:** Knowledge of inspection standards and methods for 33kV cable lines, transformers, roads, and drainage systems. Proficient with conventional inspection tools (ground resistance testers, cable fault locators, infrared thermal imagers, etc.).
* **Safety \\& Compliance:** Strict adherence to HSE policies and site procedures. Ability to identify risks and implement safety measures.
* **Teamwork:** Ability to work under guidance of international teams, with strong communication skills, responsibility, and independence in completing inspection tasks.

**Additional Requirements:**

* Willingness to stay at the wind farm site and adapt to outdoor and shift work.
* Valid driver’s license and ability to operate conventional engineering vehicles are preferred.

**What We Offer:**

* Dynamic and supportive work environment.
* Professional growth and training opportunities.
* Competitive salary and benefits.

Please Apply with your CV in English !!!!

Job Types: Full\\-time, Temporary  
Contract length: 36 months

title: ME Engineer
description:
- ***ME*** ***Engineer***

**Help shape the future of mobility** *.*

Imagine a world with zero vehicle accidents, zero vehicle emissions, and wireless vehicle connectivity all around us. Every day, we move closer to making that world a reality. Aptiv’s passionate team of engineers and developers creates advanced safety systems, high\\-performance electrification solutions and data connectivity solutions so that automakers can bring advanced capabilities to more people around the globe. This is how we enable sustainable mobility and help to prevent accidents caused by human error.


Want to join us?


**Position Summary**

Define the plant's equipment needs, to support engineering changes and new projects, as well as ensure the acquisition, installation and validation of equipment according to the start\\-up schedule.


**Your Role**

As an ME Engineer, you will be in charge of these various accountabilities:



	* Ensure the right connection between engineering changes and continuous improvement.
	* Ensure the application and monitoring of changes according to the schedule and standard procedures for project development.
	* Ensure the implementation of engineering changes in coordination with the service center.
	* Ensure compliance with all procedures related to the function.
	* Ensure good management of auxiliaries.
	* Ensuring the revision of PFMEA's for engineering changes and application of the required actions.**Your Background**


	* Bac\\+5 / Engineering degree in a technical education (or equivalent)
	* Advanced English is mandatory
	* Knowledge of manufacturing process
	* Strong analytical and synthesis skills
	* Problem solving techniques**Why join us?**


	* **You can grow at Aptiv.** Aptiv provides an inclusive work environment where all individuals can grow and develop, regardless of gender, ethnicity or beliefs.
	* **You can have an impact.** Safety is a core Aptiv value; we want a safer world for us and our children, one with: Zero fatalities, Zero injuries, Zero accidents.
	* **You have support.** We ensure you have the resources and support you need to take care of your family and your physical and mental health.**Apply today, and together let’s change tomorrow!**

title: Senior Project Manager Engineer
description:
**At TE, you will unleash your potential working with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to create a safer, sustainable and more connected world.**


**Why you should join**
-----------------------



The TE Connectivity – Industrial BCS (Board Connectivity and Sub\\-Systems) Business Unit has an opportunity available for a Sr. Project Manager engineer in our Tangier Facility. The Industrial Business Unit provides connectivity and integrated systems solutions to customers in the Industrial, Automation, Electrification \\& Energy Storage markets.



TE Connectivity’s Sr. Project Manager engineer is responsible for the management of cross functional teams supporting new product development projects. The successful candidate will work with Engineering, Product Management, Sales, Quality, Manufacturing, Finance, and other functions across TE to assure projects meet financial, schedule and customer expectations. The Project Manager is responsible for defining and creating project schedules and ensuring project tasks are executed per that schedule. Sr. Project Manager engineer is also responsible for identifying resource constraints and working with management for resolution of those constraints.


**Your main tasks**
-------------------


* Manage Sustaining Engineering projects following the Sustaining Engineering processes, with a focus on managing Value Engineering, Transfer \\& Change projects in Serial Life (post Start of Production)


Maintain project data in TE Project to achieve Industrial Business Unit data integrity goals



Ensure project progress and deliverables are achieved across all business functions to ensure compliance with Stage Gate process



Work with global project core teams to develop a project schedule and drive the project to meet that schedule



Work with the global project core teams to develop a project budget and drive the project to meet that budget



Work with Industrial Engineering to develop project P\\&Ls (Profit and Loss Calculations) and Budgetary Appropriation Requests to support capital expenditures



Update/communicate status of projects to Project Approval Committee (PAC)



Work closely with Product Management, Sales, Engineering, Finance and Operations to make sure committed New Product Sales (NPS) are achieved, committed cost savings are recorded and delivered upon



Contribute to or lead overall continuous improvement initiatives to address systemic issues in the new product development process
**Your ideal background**
-------------------------



Engineering degree in Mechanical Engineering or related fiel



At least 5 years of experience in Automotive industry with strorng knowledge of CAD and continuous improvement.



Ability to manage global project teams with key functions in multiple regions



Strong communication and presentation skills



Ability to successfully manage multiple projects and priorities



Experience in requirements evaluation, scheduling, and solving resource issues



Proven leadership in a matrix organization, able to lead by influence without authority



Integrative thinking and analytical skills



**Competencies**
----------------


SET : Strategy, Execution, Talent (for managers)**ABOUT TE CONNECTIVITY**  

TE Connectivity plc (NYSE: TEL) is a global industrial technology leader creating a safer, sustainable, productive, and connected future. Our broad range of connectivity and sensor solutions enable the distribution of power, signal and data to advance next\\-generation transportation, energy networks, automated factories, data centers, medical technology and more. With more than 85,000 employees, including 9,000 engineers, working alongside customers in approximately 130 countries, TE ensures that EVERY CONNECTION COUNTS.

  


**WHAT TE CONNECTIVITY OFFERS:**  

We are pleased to offer you an exciting total package that can also be flexibly adapted to changing life situations \\- the well\\-being of our employees is our top priority!


* Competitive Salary Package
* Performance\\-Based Bonus Plans
* Health and Wellness Incentives
* Employee Stock Purchase Program
* Community Outreach Programs / Charity Events
* Employee Resource Group

  


**IMPORTANT NOTICE REGARDING RECRUITMENT FRAUD**  

TE Connectivity has become aware of fraudulent recruitment activities being conducted by individuals or organizations falsely claiming to represent TE Connectivity. Please be advised that TE Connectivity **never requests payment or fees** from job applicants at any stage of the recruitment process. All legitimate job openings are posted exclusively on our official careers website at te.com/careers, and all email communications from our recruitment team will come **only from** **actual** **email addresses ending in @te.com**. If you receive any suspicious communications, we strongly advise you not to engage or provide any personal information, and to report the incident to your local authorities.


Across our global sites and business units, we put together packages of benefits that are either supported by TE itself or provided by external service providers. In principle, the benefits offered can vary from site to site.

title: Financial Analyst I-FAI
description:
**Your Career. Your Impact. Your Future.**



At Gentherm, we believe the next big breakthrough begins with you. As a global leader in thermal management and pneumatic comfort technologies, we develop advanced systems that deliver meaningful solutions to enhance health, wellness, comfort, and efficiency in everyday life. Our products and innovations are created for you, by you.



Be part of our team where a human\\-centric mindset drives everything we do—from the technologies we build to the careers we support. With decades of expertise, we have pioneered advanced solutions that have become a standard expectation for consumers around the world.



The same thoughtful approach we take in developing our technologies guides how we support your career: purposeful, impactful, and tailored to you. Because when you thrive, innovation thrives.

**FINANCIAL ANALYST**
---------------------


**IMPACT AND OPPORTUNITY**



The Accountant role is an exciting opportunity to make a direct impact on key accounting and finance initiatives and advance your career by quickly gaining experience in a variety of accounting areas. You will work in a collaborative team environment and be responsible for the day\\-to\\-day accounting and analysis of the balances and activity and will have the opportunity to bring new ideas for process improvement. Also, the Accountant role will routinely interact with other functions and global locations.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES**
--------------------------------------------


* Prepare journal entries, reconcile, analyze, and review general ledger accounts.
* Assist with month and quarter end close activities.
* Process vendor invoices (posting, payment run etc.).
* Posting of banks statements.
* Process petty cash.
* Provide ad hoc support for projects and transactions.
* Participate in identifying and executing continuous improvement opportunities.
* Work directly with internal and external auditors to provide analyses and audit documentation.
**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS**
--------------------------


* Bachelor’s degree in Finance or Accounting.
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in accounting.
* Proficient in English (written and spoken).
* Familiarity with U.S. GAAP or IFRS standards.
* Strong analytical and problem\\-solving abilities.
* Demonstrates a continuous learning mindset and commitment to self\\-development.
* Collaborative team player who fosters positive and effective working relationships.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills; able to independently organize meetings and clearly present ideas to individuals or groups.
* Highly motivated self\\-starter with enthusiasm, a proactive attitude, and a passion for innovation and continuous improvement.
* Adaptable and eager to learn in a dynamic, fast\\-paced environment.
* Skilled in Microsoft Office applications, particularly Excel.
**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
----------------------------


* CPA certification is preferred.
* Prior experience working in a large, multinational organization is an advantage.
* Knowledge of financial reporting and ERP systems, with SAP experience considered a plus.

At Gentherm Morocco, we offer more than a job \\- we offer a path to make a difference. We believe that innovation begins with you. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee is valued and empowered to grow.  

  

We encourage all qualified candidates to apply. Only applicants selected for interviews will be contacted.


Job Req ID: 9904
Country/Region: MA
Published: Nov 6, 2025  

  

**Job Segment:** Financial Analyst, Accounting, Business Process, CPA, ERP, Finance, Management, Technology

description:

Renault Tanger Exploit

Renault Tanger Exploitation propose des stages de fin d’études destinés aux étudiants souhaitant contribuer à des projets stratégiques dans les domaines de la finance, du contrôle de gestion et de l’ingénierie industrielle. Ces stages offrent l’opportunité de participer à des missions variées telles que l’optimisation des coûts , le contrôle qualité des nomenclatures, et l’analyse des PRF moteurs et la détection des causes racine des écarts.
Les stagiaires joueront un rôle clé dans le développement de solutions innovantes visant à :* Renforcer la performance économique et opérationnelle d’usine.
* Améliorer la fiabilité et la qualité des données et processus industriels.
* Contribuer à la digitalisation et à l’automatisation des pratiques de gestion et de production.

title: Confirmed Data Scientist – Full Stack Developer
description:
**VDD AI**


Marrakech
Stage
Sur site
il y a 3 semaine(s)
  
We are in search of a talented professional to join our team as a Data Scientist / Full Stack Dev in our Marrakech Office. In this capacity, you’ll play a pivotal role in designing, developing, Data Apps and maintaining advanced data processing and machine learning systems. This is an internship with the opportunity of becoming a full time employment.



Key Responsibilities
* Own end\\-to\\-end feature delivery: Design system architecture, model data, implement APIs/services, and build responsive UIs from spec to production.
* Maintain reliability, performance, and security: Write robust tests, instrument observability (logs/metrics/traces), optimize queries and frontend performance, and enforce secure coding/practices.
* Execute pre\\-defined data architectures and flows to serve business needs conveniently.
* Define, optimise, and monitor cloud components.
* Build data integration, transformation, and aggregation scripts.
* Create data fetching and application models and controller scripts (MVC applications).
* Build and monitor data connections and flows.
* Identify, develop, manage, and execute analyses to uncover areas of opportunity and present business recommendations.
* Collaborate with multiple teams as a practitioner of data structures and transformation and where you develop solutions that utilise the highest standards of transformation rigor and data integrity.
* Accompany, facilitate, and support data visualisations and insights extractions in applications and BI/Reporting tools.

Requirements
* Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Applied Mathematics, or related fields.
* Record of delivering analytical solutions with business impact.
* Expertise in SQL/Python is mandatory.
* Strong in one modern frontend framework (React preferred; Vue/Next OK), plus solid HTML/CSS fundamentals.
* Understanding of data structures, data modeling, and software architecture.
* Ability to communicate complex data concepts in a clear and effective manner.
* A strong knack for problem\\-solving and a keen eye for detail.
* Good experience with main clouds (AWS, GCP, Azure) and managed services (Snowflake, Databricks) or similar technologies is highly appreciated.


Joining our team, you’ll have the chance to utilize cutting\\-edge technologies, collaborate with top\\-tier professionals, and contribute significantly to our data\\-driven decision\\-making processes. If you’re passionate about data infrastructure, we’d love to hear from you.



Additional Information
* **Job Types:** Full\\-time, Internship
* **Contract length:** 6 months
* **Pay:** 12,000\\.00DH – 16,000\\.00DH per month
* **Ability to commute/relocate:**
	+ Marrakech: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Data Scientist
description:
Casablanca



Regular



**MERIEUX NUTRISCIENCES**



As a trusted partner, our Public Health mission is to make food systems safer, healthier and more sustainable. Throughout our global network in 27 countries, we offer to our customers a wide range of testing and innovative solutions dedicated to preventing health risks related to food, environment and consumer goods. External growth has been a key pillar of our history with more than 40 acquisitions completed in the last 10 years.  

  

 If you want to contribute to an inspiring long\\-term purpose, to be part of a fast growing company on a high\\-value market with significant build\\-up opportunities, and to grow in an entrepreneurial and warm environment, **join us!**


**YOUR DAY TO DAY LIFE**



We are looking for a **Data Scientist** in N°1 \\- Bd de Bangkok \\- Zoute de Zenate \\-Km 10,5 \\- S MAR. Your mission will be to:



At Mérieux NutriSciences, we leverage over 50 years of scientific and entrepreneurial expertise to answer food industry needs.  

Today’s global challenges transform the way food is produced, marketed and consumed, which is why we know our clients need more than reliable analytical results; they need practical and innovative solutions that will contribute to make food systems safer, healthier and more sustainable.


From our initial expertise in microbiology and consulting, we have broadened our scope of scientific specialties into chemistry, education, certification, research, labelling, and sensory in order to offer a complete suite of services to meet our customers’ needs.  

Today, we offer comprehensive solutions to support our clients, from product development to market suitability, while contributing to consumers’ health worldwide. Present worldwide, we are more than 100 accredited laboratories and a team of over 10,000 committed employees.


We strongly believe that together, we can create solutions to offer our planet: BETTER FOOD. BETTER HEALTH. BETTER WORLD.  

If you want to contribute to an inspiring long\\-term purpose, to be part of a fast growing company on a high\\-value market with significant build\\-up opportunities, and to grow in an entrepreneurial and warm environment, join us!  

Job responsibilities


We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our IT Innovation Lab! As a Data Scientist, you will be responsible for developing and implementing data\\-driven solutions that improve business outcomes. You will work closely with the digital team and the data team to develop predictive models, analyze large datasets, and communicate insights to stakeholders.


You will be a key member of the Global Data \\& AI Team.

* You will be responsible for :
* Develop models and solutions using machine learning, deep learning and generative AI
* Clean, standardize, harmonize, analyze large datasets to identify trends and patterns
* Communicate insights to stakeholders
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams to develop data\\-driven solutions
* Stay up\\-to\\-date with emerging trends in data science

 **YOUR PROFILE**



Required skills:

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or related field
* Experience with Python
* Experience with machine learning algorithms and neural networks
* Experience with Generative AI (LLMs)
* Strong analytical skills including data visualization
* Demonstrates interpersonal skills required to successfully work in a team environment, communicates effectively across a variety of stakeholder groups
* Self\\-motivated, proactive and ability to manage multiple tasks concurrently
* Strong documentations, written and verbal communication skills


**WHY JOIN US?**


* Because you would contribute to an inspiring **Public Health purpose,** supported by long\\-term and visionary shareholders.
* Because you would have an **impact on our strategic pillars** that build on 50 years of experience and expertise.
* Because you would be part of a community of **an enthusiastic and skilled group of people** who love **co\\-building** together and serving a purpose bigger than them.
* Because you would be **welcome as you are**, in a diverse and open\\-minded environment that is rich in our singularities and differences.
* Because you would grow in an **international group of more than 8200 fantastic team members**, with plenty of opportunities to learn and share.


**Ready for the journey?**

description:
We are growing! We are currently looking to hire a
 **Freelance Data Scientist / NLP Engineer \\- Text Analytics \\& Sentiment Analysis** 
 to work with us remotely for a period of 4 months.
   

  

**Who we are:**
 Founded in 2006, we're proud to be a global business. From Shanghai to Paris, we have 12 offices and operate across four continents in 70 countries. We are home to over 250 professionals from around the world, working together to serve more than 230 luxury clients.
   

  

 At CXG, we love to evolve, elevate, and transform experiences while bringing brand promises to life. We offer strategic solutions that impact performance and elevate the customer experience of some of the world's most iconic premium and luxury brands.
   

  

**What you will be doing:**
 As part of its data solution industrialization initiatives, the company aims to design, train, and deploy text analytics and sentiment classification models within its Snowflake environment. The consultant will be involved from requirements definition to production deployment, working in the Data \\& AI team.
   

  

**Your duties will also involve:**
* Analyze business needs and define use cases for text analytics (e.g., customer feedback, support tickets, survey responses)
* Collect, clean, and prepare structured and unstructured text data in Snowflake
* Design, train, and evaluate NLP models, including: Sentiment analysis \\- Text classification \\- Keyword extraction / topic modeling
* Develop processing workflows
* Deploy models within the Snowflake environment (Snowpark / UDF / UDTF)
* Create documentation and provide knowledge transfer to internal teams


**Requirements**
**What you will bring along:**
* Strong expertise in NLP / Text Analytics (Python, spaCy, Hugging Face, Transformers, etc.)
* Proven experience building sentiment analysis and text classification models
* Solid knowledge of Snowflake, including: \\- Snowpark (Python) \\- Development of UDF/UDTF functions \\- Integration with external stages \\& warehouses
* Proficiency in Python (pandas, numpy, scikit\\-learn, ideally MLflow)
* Experience with data pipelines and orchestration tools (Airflow, dbt, Prefect, etc., depending on internal stack)
* Understanding of MLOps practices (CI/CD, model versioning, monitoring)
* Ability to work independently and structure deliverables
* Strong communication and documentation skills
* Ability to collaborate effectively with both technical and non\\-technical stakeholders

title: DÉVELOPPEURS SENIOR IA / DATA SCIENTIST
description:
**Créée en 2012 Uniiti est une start\\-up française qui a pour mission d’aider les commerces de proximité et les entreprises à attirer plus de clients et à mieux les fidéliser grâce à Internet.** 




**\\*** 




**Pour cela, la société propose une solution de communication tout en un qui permet de gérer son site web, ses réservations, ses ventes en ligne, ses prises de rendez vous, ses avis, ses campagnes d’emailing et bien d’autres fonctionnalités qui permettent aux commerces et aux entreprises de développer leur activité grâce à Internet.** 




**\\*** 




**\\*** 




**La startup compte aujourd’hui plus de 7000 clients et part à la conquête de 5000 clients supplémentaires pour l’année 2026\\.** 




**Pour plus d'information https://business.uniiti.com ou https://udevweb.co** 




**\\*** 




**\\*** 




 Dans ce contexte, nous recherchons un(e)
 **Développeur(se) spécialisé(e) en Intelligence Artificielle** 
 pour renforcer notre équipe de développement et accélérer le développement de nos solutions innovantes. Vous travaillerez sur la conception, l’intégration et l’industrialisation de cas d’usage IA (LLM, Machine Learning, RAG, automatisation) au service de nos produits SaaS.l

**Missions principales :** 



* Conception et développement de solutions IA en Python,
* Concevoir et implémenter des modèles de Machine Learning et Deep Learning pour répondre à des problématiques métiers variées (prédiction, classification, NLP, computer vision, etc.)
* Mise en place de pipelines RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) pour améliorer la pertinence des modèles,
* Automatiser les processus d’analyse et de reporting via des outils et frameworks modernes
* Exploitation du cloud AWS et en particulier des services IA/LLM (ex. Bedrock),
* Intégration d’outils IA et d’orchestration (Llama,N8N, OpenAI, Claude, …),
* Expérimentation et amélioration continue via prompt engineering et fine\\-tuning de modèles,
* Veille technologique sur les innovations IA et proposition d’idées/concepts pour enrichir nos produits,
* Collaboration avec les équipes produit, data et dev pour industrialiser des solutions IA fiables et scalables.
* Assurer la qualité, la traçabilité et la sécurité des données
* Effectuer une veille active sur les avancées en IA, LLMs, MLOps et Data Engineering



 \\*
 



**Compétences techniques attendues :** 



* Maîtrise du langage
 **Python,**
* Connaissances avancées en
 **LLM et techniques de prompting,**
* Pratique : du
 **RAG** 
 et des architectures de recherche de données contextuelles,
* Expérience sur
 **AWS** 
 (idéalement Bedrock, Lambda, S3, etc.),
* Familiarité avec des outils d’orchestration et d’automatisation (ex.
 **N8N** 
 ),
* Bonne culture des APIs IA (OpenAI, Claude, etc.).



 \\*
 



**Soft skills :** 



* **Force de proposition** 
 : capable de transformer la veille technologique en solutions concrètes,
* **Autonomie esprit analytique et rigueur** 
 ,dans le développement, et goût pour le travail collaboratif à distance
* Goût pour le
 **travail collaboratif** 
 (produit, QA, data, dev),
* **Curiosité,** 
 bonne compréhension des enjeux
 **business,** 
 et
 **capacité** 
 à vulgariser l’IA pour des profils non techniques.



 \\*
 



**Profil recherché :** 



* Diplôme d’ingénieur ou Master (Bac\\+5\\) en
 **Data Science** 
 ,
 **IA** 
 ,
 **informatique** 
 ou
 **ingénierie**
* Expérience confirmée
 **3 à 6 ans d’expérience** 
 professionnelle en data science, machine learning ou ingénierie de données en développement logiciel avec un focus IA,
* Excellente maîtrise de
 **Python** 
 et de ses principales librairies data (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit\\-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.)
* Solides compétences en bases de données (SQL / NoSQL) et en déploiement de modèles (API, Docker, cloud, etc.)
* Expérience dans un contexte cloud (idéalement AWS),
* Première expérience en mise en production de solutions IA/LLM.



 \\*
 



**IMPORTANT:** 




**\\*** 




**Très bon niveau de français exigé.** 




**\\*** 




**Pour plus d’informations sur notre société et sur nos services rendez vous sur business.uniiti.fr** 




**\\*** 




**Cette mission responsabilisante et motivante se fera dans une équipe jeune et dynamique basée dans le quartier du Guéliz à Marrakech.** 




 \\*
 



**Type d'emploi : Temps plein** 




 \\*
 



**Salaire : 15 000 DHS à 25 000,DHS par mois**

title: Data Scientist
description:
**The Role**
* Analyse large and complex datasets to uncover trends, correlations, and actionable patterns.
* Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualisations that provide stakeholders with clear, data\\-driven insights.
* Translate business problems into structured data questions and analytical approaches.
* Evaluate data quality and suggest improvements to ensure accuracy and reliability.
* Collaborate with product, engineering, and business teams to understand requirements and deliver relevant analyses.
* Conduct statistical analysis and build models to support forecasting, segmentation, or performance measurement.
* Test hypotheses and interpret results to inform strategic and operational decisions.
* Document analytical methods, assumptions, and findings for transparency and reproducibility.


**Ideal Profile**
* You possess an advanced degree, ideally a PHD, in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or a related field.
* You have at least 7 years of experience, ideally within a Data Scientist role.
* Strong expertise in Python, R, or similar languages, and data science libraries (e.g., Pandas, Scikit\\-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
* Advanced knowledge of statistical modelling, predictive analytics, machine learning, and AI techniques.
* Experience working with large, complex datasets and building scalable data pipelines.
* Strong SQL and database skills, with experience in data warehousing or cloud\\-based data platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).
* Proven experience deploying models into production and monitoring performance at scale.


 What's on Offer?
   

  

* Flexible working options
* Opportunity to make a positive impact
* Great work environment

title: Développeur IOS

**ALTEN MAROC** 
 , Filiale du leader mondial de l’ingénierie et du conseil en technologie créé en 2008 et présent à Fès, Rabat, Tétouan et Casablanca, compte aujourd’hui plus de 2200 collaborateurs et vise un centre d’excellence de 3300 ALTENiens en fin 2027\\.  Notre mission : répondre aux ambitions technologiques de nos clients — grands donneurs d’ordre internationaux — dans les secteurs de l’automobile, du ferroviaire, de la R\\&D et de l’IT, des télécommunications et des médias.

title: Backend Engineer (Python, Mid-Level)
description:
**👀TL;DR** 



* Elite team of BE engineers building complex AI accounting \\& fintech product
* Huge momentum, growing fast, huge product \\& AI roadmap
* High\\-speed development \\- one of the fastest teams on the planet
* Comp: $70k\\-$145k USD base \\+ $50k USD equity ($120k\\-$195k USD total)
* Raised $90M Series A in September from Lightspeed, Khosla, Google Ventures
* Remote with in\\-person meetups \\& daily New York EST timezone overlap
* Founders built \\& exited prior company at $100M ARR and 350\\+ people



  





**Why This Role Matters Now** 




 The current accounting software is outdated, overpriced, and inefficient, burdened by manual processes.
 



  





 DualEntry is the AI\\-native ERP for Finance teams \\- and we’re looking for experienced backend engineers to accelerate our roadmap development. You’ll architect features and systems end to end at an incredible pace.
 



  





 This is an opportunity to build the first, true AI accounting product with your own hands \\- as part of our elite team.
 



  





**About DualEntry** 



* Founded in 2024, DualEntry is one of NYC’s fastest\\-growing AI startups, backed by top\\-tier VCs and 30\\+ unicorn founders.
* Our founding team previously scaled a startup from $2K in savings to $100M ARR and a successful exit \\- after raising $380M\\+ in funding.
* Now, we’re building the next wave of enterprise infrastructure: AI\\-powered, automation\\-first, and built for mid\\-market finance teams tired of outdated tools.



  





 We move fast, deploy to prod daily, and build with a deep sense of ownership.
 



  





 📍
 **Location:** 
 Remote with overlap for US ET timezone (NYC HQ)
 



  





**Where You’ll Create Impact** 



* Design and build core backend systems using Python
* Build APIs, services, and infrastructure that handle real\\-time, business\\-critical and complex accounting logic
* Launch production\\-ready features from scratch, including CI/CD pipelines and deployment
* Work with product to turn complex finance workflows into performant, secure systems
* Manage complexity in a business\\-logic\\-heavy product, including data migrations and scale challenges
* Integrate third\\-party tools and external systems \\- proactively managing edge cases and risk
* Own your work from architecture to testing, monitoring, and post\\-release care



  





**How You’ll Work** 




 You’ll collaborate with:
 



  




* **Founders** 
 , to understand core use cases and product priorities
* **Product** 
 , to co\\-design features from first principles
* **Frontend Engineers** 
 , to ensure seamless delivery across the stack



  





 You’ll work independently, make architectural calls, and deploy to production every day (!).
 



  





**What Sets You Up for Success** 



* 5\\+ years of experience in backend engineering
* Deep experience with complex business logic products
* Proficient in Python and a modern web framework (FastAPI, Flask, or Django)
* Experience deploying on AWS (or similar cloud infrastructure)
* Strong database skills: PostgreSQL, SQL, ORMs, migrations, schema design
* Experience building and testing robust APIs
* Solid understanding of software lifecycle, CI/CD, and production\\-readiness
* Ability to manage complex systems with evolving requirements
* Fluent in English (C1\\+) with strong written and verbal communication



  





**How You Operate** 



* **Pragmatic** 
 : you like to move forward and make decisions based in reality (not theory). We don't debate if Cassandra has the most theoretical scalability \\-\\- we use Postgres until it breaks
* **Hard working** 
 : 'You can work long, hard, or smart, but \\[here] you can't choose two out of three" \\- Jeff Bezos. We wrote this job post during the weekend
* **Curious** 
 : you love to learn, are highly curious about new frameworks and solutions to engineering problems
* **Fast\\-moving** 
 \\- You deploy daily, iterate quickly, and never wait for permission



  





**Why You’ll Thrive Here** 



* You’ll help build the foundational backend of a product with massive market pull
* You’ll work with a high\\-trust, high\\-speed team that cares about clean code and clear ownership
* You’ll see your work go live weekly and shape how modern finance teams operate
* You’ll grow fast \\- with full visibility and real responsibility



  





**Compensation \\& Benefits** 



* Base salary: $70K–$145K USD
* Equity: \\~$50K\\+ USD
* B2B contract (regular employment contract available)
* Remote\\-first team \\- the fastest team you will have ever worked with
* 15 PTO days \\+ 12 public holidays
* Visa sponsorship option for relocation to NYC within 2 years
* Freedom, autonomy, and impact from day one



  





 If you're excited to build systems that power AI and build the first true accounting AI product with your own hands \\- we’d love to hear from you.

title: AI Software Engineer (F/H/X)
description:
Syensqo is all about chemistry. We’re not just referring to chemical reactions here, but also to the magic that occurs when the brightest minds get to work together. This is where our true strength lies. In you. In your future colleagues and in all your differences. And of course, in your ideas to improve lives while preserving our planet’s beauty for the generations to come.
   

***Job title :***
* AI Software Engineer (F/H/X)


 The position reports to the Technical Lead.
   

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Collaborate and Innovate: Work closely with product managers, designers, and other engineers to build best\\-in\\-class AI\\-enabled features for our products.
* AI Integration: Implement and integrate AI technologies, such as Generative AI, machine learning models, or NLP, to enhance our platform’s capabilities, optimize processes, and improve user experiences.
* Platform Development: Design, develop, and maintain scalable AI platform features to enable feature teams, while ensuring they are compatible with other services, and APIs.
* Rapid Problem\\-Solving: Quickly fix bugs and solve problems, particularly related to AI performance, model integration, or data pipeline issues, to enhance customer satisfaction.
* Continuous Improvement: Participate in code reviews and contribute to improving our AI development processes, ensuring that the AI components are scalable, efficient, and maintainable.
* Stay Current: Maintain up\\-to\\-date knowledge of industry trends and advancements in AI, machine learning, and cloud services


***Education and experiences***
* Specific Knowledge/Experience:
+ At least 4 years of experience as a Software Engineer
+ Proven track record of working in AI products development
+ Expertise in Python, valuable Java, Scala, C\\#
+ Knowledge in microservices, valuable graphQL
+ Knowledge in Data management \\& data structures such as Json schema, Avro
+ Knowledge in DevOp as Jenkins pipelines, docker and some experience deploying models (MLOps, LLMOps, AIOps)
+ Strong understanding of GenAI/AI/ML technologies with knowledge in concepts as AI flow, evaluation, training, scoring, prompting, guardrails and RAG
+ Experience with Cloud providers as Azure, GCP or AWS
+ Experience in Agile development methodologies, particularly SCRUM.

* Valuable knowledge: distributed architectures, akka concepts, NLP projects, standard methodologies and principles, software patterns
* Proficiency in using project management and collaboration tools (e.g., JIRA, Trello)
* Strong organizational \\& time management skills
* Cloud certifications is a plus
* Fluent in English (proficient in French is a plus).
* Strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills.
* Creativity, curiosity and a passion for innovation and technology.


**About Us**
* This position requires a certain level of integrity, confidentiality, loyalty and trustworthiness as you will have access to Syensqo's most sensitive information or systems in the context of your mission. Please note that the selected person for this position will be required to undergo and meet company standards for vetting verifications and reference checks.
* Syensqo is a science company developing groundbreaking solutions that enhance the way we live, work, travel and play. Inspired by the scientific councils which Ernest Solvay initiated in 1911, we bring great minds together to push the limits of science and innovation for the benefit of our customers, with a diverse, global team of more than 13,000 associates. Our solutions contribute to safer, cleaner, and more sustainable products found in homes, food and consumer goods, planes, cars, batteries, smart devices and health care applications. Our innovation power enables us to deliver on the ambition of a circular economy and explore breakthrough technologies that advance humanity.
* At Syensqo, we seek to promote unity and not uniformity. We value the diversity that individuals bring and we invite you to consider a future with us, regardless of background, age, gender, national origin, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, ability or identity. We encourage individuals who may require any assistance or accommodations to let us know to ensure a seamless application experience. We are here to support you throughout the application journey and want to ensure all candidates are treated equally. If you are unsure whether you meet all the criteria or qualifications listed in the job description, we still encourage you to apply.

title: Data Engineer
description:
ALTEN Maroc, filiale du leader mondial du conseil en ingénierie et en technologies, a été créée en 2008 et est aujourd’hui présente à Fès, Rabat, Tétouan et Casablanca. L’entreprise compte actuellement plus de 2 200 collaborateurs et ambitionne de devenir un centre d’excellence avec 3 300 ALTENiens d’ici fin 2027\\. Elle s’est imposée comme un acteur stratégique dans l’accompagnement du développement professionnel des ingénieurs.
   

  

**Notre mission :** 
 répondre aux ambitions technologiques de nos clients — de grandes entreprises internationales — dans les secteurs de l’automobile, du ferroviaire, de la R\\&D et de l’informatique, des télécommunications et des médias.

 , c’est intégrer un écosystème d’excellence et bénéficier de :

**Description Du Poste**

* Collaborer avec les équipes métiers pour comprendre les besoins en données et proposer des solutions adaptées.


**Qualifications**
 Titulaire d'un bac\\+5 en Informatique, Data Science, Big Data, ou équivalent, avec une expérience en Power BI, Databricks, Power Automate, Excel/VBA et Python, vous disposez des compétences suivantes:
   

  

**Compétences techniques :**

 Python : manipulation et traitement de données (pandas, numpy), visualisation (matplotlib, seaborn), scripting.
   

  

* SQL : conception de requêtes, optimisation et intégration dans les processus de données.
* Data Quality \\& ETL : contrôle, nettoyage et transformation des données.


**Compétences comportementales :**
* Rigueur et sens du détail.
* Capacité d’analyse et de résolution de problèmes complexes.
* Esprit collaboratif et communication efficace avec les équipes métiers.
* Orientation résultats et amélioration continue.
* Autonomie et capacité à gérer plusieurs projets simultanément.


**Langues :**
* Français : courant
* Anglais : professionnel (technique et communication


**Informations supplémentaires**
 Vous êtes rigoureux(se), créatif(ve) et curieux(se), et vous aimez travailler en équipe tout en développant vos compétences dans un environnement dynamique. title: Solutions Engineer
description:
At F5, we strive to bring a better digital world to life. Our teams empower organizations across the globe to create, secure, and run applications that enhance how we experience our evolving digital world. We are passionate about cybersecurity, from protecting consumers from fraud to enabling companies to focus on innovation.
   

  

 Everything we do centers around people. That means we obsess over how to make the lives of our customers, and their customers, better. And it means we prioritize a diverse F5 community where each individual can thrive.
   

  

 At F5, our mission is based on the fact that businesses depend on apps.
   

  

 Our long\\-standing belief that applications are the most valuable assets of any organization in the digital age has been the foundation of our strategy to become the leader in multi\\-cloud application services. When you combine F5’s, expertise powering over half of the world’s applications across all types of environments, you have a company that knows how to deliver and secure more applications, and more value, than any company in the industry.
   

  

 This means that we are able to deliver and protect applications—revenue generating, brand\\-anchoring applications—from the point at which they are created through to the point when consumers interact with them. In other words, from “code to customer.” This makes the combined forces of F5, absolutely essential to every digital organization in the world, including the world’s largest enterprises, service providers, financial and educational institutions, government entities, and consumer brands.
   

  

 At F5 we actively build a culture that everyone can be themselves and reach their full potential. As a global business leader, we know diversity drives innovation, makes everything we build better for our customers, and fuels our success.  We know the magic ingredient is our differences, when embraced with humility and respect. And because we know this, we believe that top talent is found in a diversity of individual backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives to help us all thrive.
   

  

 We currently have an opportunity for a talented Solutions Engineer (SE) to join our Morocco team. This is a sales and technical role with focus on customer/partners and is part of the sales organization. The SE’s primary responsibility is to support the sales team with technical skills and provide technical knowledge around F5 solutions to our customers. To be effective, an SE needs to have excellent technical skills and knowledge on both F5 products and the “eco\\-system” that we work in. Fear not, we do provide training and certification to keep abreast with these critical skills!
   

  

 The high\\-level objective is to achieve the allocated sales target and selling relevant F5 solutions and products to our customers business needs, in partnership with the Sales Account Manager. From our customer(s) perspective, the SE is a trusted adviser who proactively learns and understands their technical and business challenges and can propose effective solutions to mitigate their concerns/offer gainful solutions. The F5 SE not only presents the technical features but also business benefits in the Technical Value Proposition.
   

  

 Primary Responsibilities:
   

  

* Responsible for upholding F5’s Business Code of Ethics and for promptly reporting violations of the Code or other company policies.


 Global Responsibilities
   

  

* Provides complex design and systems engineering configurations
* Partners with product development and product management to assist with Change Request (CR) and Customer Special Request (CSR) cases
* Maintains a high level of technical knowledge of F5 and the relevant industry
* Utilize the F5 Sales Strategy and Solution Messaging to identify solutions for customer business objectives
* Participate in the development and support of presentations for customers and partners
* Clearly articulate technical elements of the F5 value proposition to customers and partners
* Maintain knowledge of competitive landscape and share knowledge with CAT team
* Contribute to the creation of case studies, white papers, and media articles for customers and/or partners
* Foster a collaborative, team\\-based environment, sharing best practices and building lasting relationships
* Effectively negotiate and pursue conflict resolution
* Actively utilize SE tools: SalesForce.com, Idea, EDGE, Mainstreet and other SE readiness programs
* Partner with sales team to maintain detailed account profiles including organizational charts, customer products, strategy and technology needs
* Understand and effectively utilize F5 organizational resources
* Consistently provide world\\-class customer service during pre\\-sales, implementation, and post\\-sales activities
* Lead strategic (organizational) opportunities
* Well developed SME focus for one technology
* Deliver customized product presentations using an advanced solution\\-based sales approach
* Proactively provide consultative support
* Create customer documentation for POC
* Understand business requirements involved with technical account strategy
* Work effectively with Engineering, Product Development, and Technical Support organizations
* Solve problems independently and creatively
* Perform other related duties as assigned


 Channel support activities include:
   

  

* Support F5 channel partner sales initiatives
* Provide channel partners sustainable training on F5 solutions and competitive differentiation
* Provide channel partners technical expertise and oversight as required
* Proactively provide consultative support
* Work in collaboration with Channel and Sales management to establish channel partners and to qualify partner’s ability to sell F5 solutions


 Post sales activities include:
   

  

* Understand and follow escalation process
* Partner with the F5 Technical Support and customers/partners to resolve issues


**Qualifications**
* Multiple years of related experience working within Cloud, Security, Application Delivery, Network Infrastructure, DevOps, SaaS, IaaS or PaaS environments.
* Strong presentation, communication, account management (pre\\-sales) skills
* Significant experience and a number of years pre\\-sales / Systems Engineering expertise
* BS/BA or equivalent work experience
* F5 core product experience or relevant experience in key competitor offerings required
* In\\-depth industry knowledge and understanding of F5 technologies, solutions and product offerings strongly preferred
* Advanced written and oral communication skills
* First class presentation skills
* Effective written and oral communication skills
* Experience with MS office suite or Works
* Fluent verbal and writing skills in French, Arabic and English


 Physical Demands and Work Environment
   

  

* While we encourage remote/virtual meetings, the nature of the role requires travel
* This is a self\\-driven role, so career growth and development are available at every stage of your career
* Competitive pay, family friendly benefits, and cool perks


 F5 is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes diversity in the workplace.
   

  

 The Job Description is intended to be a general representation of the responsibilities and requirements of the job. However, the description may not be all\\-inclusive, and responsibilities and requirements are subject to change.
   

  

 Please note that F5 only contacts candidates through F5 email address (ending with @f5\\.com) or auto email notification from Yello/Workday (ending with f5\\.com or @myworkday.com).

 It is the policy of F5 to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and employment applicants without regard to unlawful considerations of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, sensory, physical, or mental disability, marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws. This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, discipline, and termination. title: Data Analyst
description:
**Job Overview**

We are seeking a **Data Analyst** to join our team and work exclusively on a project with a U.S.\\-based client in the **property insurance industry**. In this role, you will be responsible for integrating and analyzing high\\-quality public and vendor data to support **product development** and **sales initiatives**.

Your responsibilities will include:

* Ensuring the **accuracy, consistency, and quality** of data
* Designing, building, and optimizing **reports and dashboards**
* Documenting **best practices** and ensuring **regulatory compliance**
* Collaborating with internal teams to support and enhance **data infrastructure**
* Identifying opportunities for **process improvements** and recommending solutions
* Contributing to **special projects**, supporting team members, and engaging in **continuous learning**

**Background \\& Experience**

* A bachelor's/master’s degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, Management Information Systems or similar field
* 2\\+ years of data analytics work in an English setting, preferably for US/Canada based clients

**Key Qualifications**

A good fit for the position MUST have the following qualifications:

* **Excellent** written and oral English communication skills
* Advanced **SQL** skills (Database concepts, advanced querying with window functions)
* Advanced **Python** skills (Pandas, NumPy)
* Capability to apply machine learning and statistical modeling techniques to real\\-world datasets and business use cases
* Hands\\-on experience with **ETL processes** and **data engineering workflows** (data pipelines, transformation, integration, and optimization)
* Advanced **Excel** skills (PivotTable, Macros, VBA)
* Strong problem\\-solving mindset with attention to detail
* Ability to work independently while thriving in a **collaborative team environment**
* Strong sense of **punctuality**, **reliability**, and accountability
* Willingness and commitment to work **full\\-time**

**Job Benefits**

* Permanent full\\-time employment (CDI)
* Training Provided
* Social Security
* Performance Bonus

**Business Hours**

* Monday\\-Friday 8:00am to 6:00pm (United States Eastern Standard Time)

o Note: Hours are subject to change given client and business needs

**Job Compensation**

* Base Salary \\+ Performance Bonus

Job Types: Full\\-time, Permanent

Pay: 7,000\\.00DH \\- 14,000\\.00DH per month

Application Question(s):

* Where do you currently live?
* Do you understand that this job is in person in Fes, Morocco? Please do not apply if you are only looking for remote positions.
* Have you ever worked in data analytics with US/Canada clients in English?
* Rate your English level from 1 to 10\\. (1\\= Beginner; 10\\=Expert)
* Rate your SQL level from 1 to 10\\. (1\\= Beginner; 10\\=Expert)
* Rate your Python level from 1 to 10\\. (1\\= Beginner; 10\\=Expert)
* Rate your Microsoft Excel level from 1 to 10\\. (1\\= Beginner; 10\\=Expert)

Education:

* Engineering School (Preferred)

Experience:

* Data Analytics: 4 years (Preferred)

Language:

* English (Required)

Job Type: Full\\-time

Pay: 7,000\\.00DH \\- 14,000\\.00DH per month

Application Question(s):

* Where do you currently live?
* Do you understand that this job is in person in Fes, Morocco? **\\*\\***NOT REMOTE**\\*\\***\\*
* Have you ever worked in data analytics with US/Canada clients in English?
* Rate your English level from 1 to 10\\. (1\\= Beginner; 10\\=Expert)
* Rate your SQL level from 1 to 10\\. (1\\= Beginner; 10\\=Expert)
* Rate your Python level from 1 to 10\\. (1\\= Beginner; 10\\=Expert)
* Rate your Microsoft Excel level from 1 to 10\\. (1\\= Beginner; 10\\=Expert)

Education:

* Engineering School (Preferred)

Experience:

* Data Analyst: 1 year (Required)

title: Business Analyst Data
description:
Choisir Capgemini, c’est choisir une entreprise où vous serez en mesure de façonner votre carrière selon vos aspirations. Avec le soutien et l'inspiration d'une communauté d’experts dans le monde entier, vous pourrez réécrire votre futur. Rejoignez\\-nous pour redéfinir les limites de ce qui est possible, contribuer à libérer la valeur de la technologie pour les plus grandes organisations et participer à la construction d’un monde plus durable et inclusif.
   

  

 Votre mission
   

  

 Au sein de nos équipes projet, vous contribuerez au développement de solutions digitales innovantes pour des clients grands comptes dans les secteurs banque, assurance, énergie et industrie. Vous intégrerez une équipe pluridisciplinaire, organisée en mode Agile, et intervenant sur des projets à fort impact métier.
   

  

 En tant que Business Analyst vous interviendrez dans des missions variées telles que :
   

  

* Recueillir, formaliser et challenger les besoins des équipes métiers en lien avec les données.
* Rédiger des spécifications fonctionnelles et techniques, concevoir des modèles de données et des flux d'information.
* Participer à la gestion de projets BI/Data (planning, coordination, suivi des livrables).
* Travailler étroitement avec les Data Engineers, Data Scientists et développeurs pour assurer la cohérence des solutions livrées.
* Mettre en place des indicateurs de performance, analyser les résultats et proposer des axes d’amélioration.


 Votre profil
   

  

* Bac\\+5 en informatique, statistiques ou école de commerce avec spécialisation Data. Expérience de 6 à 8 ans en tant que Business Analyst dans un environnement Data.
* Bonne maîtrise de SQL, Power BI/Tableau, connaissance des outils ETL (Talend, SSIS, Dataiku) et des environnements Cloud (AWS, GCP ou Azure).
* Capacité à interpréter les données, à identifier les tendances et à formuler des recommandations pertinentes.
* Aisance dans la communication avec des interlocuteurs métiers et techniques, capacité à vulgariser des concepts complexes.
* Force de proposition, capable de travailler en autonomie tout en collaborant efficacement en équipe.


 Quelques raisons de nous rejoindre
   

  

* Qualité de vie au travail : Possibilité de télétravail au Maroc ainsi qu’a l’international et autonomie dans l’organisation de votre quotidien, missions hybrides selon vos préférences.
* Apprentissage en continu : accédez aux formations et certifications dédiées à votre techno, accompagnement personnalisé et parcours d’intégration structuré.
* Projets variés et à fort impact : intervenez auprès de grands comptés dans des secteurs diversifiés avec des enjeux métiers et technologiques stimulants.
* Écosystème d’expertise : bénéficiez d’un accompagnement technique personnalisé et d’une intégration active dans nos communautés métiers.


**Nos Engagements Et Priorités**
 Le groupe Capgemini encourage une culture inclusive dans un cadre multiculturel et handi\\-accueillant. En nous rejoignant, vous intégrez un collectif qui valorise la diversité, développe le potentiel de ses talents, s’engage dans des initiatives solidaires avec ses partenaires, et se mobilise pour réduire son impact environnemental sur tous ses sites et auprès de ses clients.
   

  

 Capgemini est un leader mondial, responsable et multiculturel, regroupant près de 350 000 personnes dans plus de 50 pays. Fort de 55 ans d’expérience, nous sommes un partenaire stratégique des entreprises pour la transformation de leurs activités en tirant profit de toute la puissance de la technologie et des innovations dans les domaines en perpétuelle évolution tels que le cloud, la data, l’Intelligence Artificielle, la connectivité, les logiciels, l’ingénierie digitale ou les plateformes.

title: Associate analyst
description:
**Job Category**
 Customer Support/Operations
   

  

**Pay Grade Range**
 د.م.‏70,000\\.00 \\- د.م.‏130,000\\.00
   

  

**Disclaimer:** 
 The base salary range represents the low and high end of Altus Group’s “Pay Grade Range” for this position in the primary work location. Actual hiring salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to work experience, and geographic market data for the role. The Pay Grade Range listed above does not reflect Altus Group’s total compensation for employees. Other rewards may include an annual bonus, flexible work arrangements, and region\\-specific benefits.
   

  

 Finance Active is a leading provider of debt management SaaS solutions to improve the performance of debt management and financial risk management: foreign exchange, investment, forecasting and guarantees. Permanently connected to the financial markets, our solutions allow the monitoring and valuation of positions, and simplify the management of operations considered complex.
   

  

 We provide exceptional insights and a high level of support to finance teams. Our ambition is to increase their operating margin, maximize financial performance and streamline decision\\-making. In April 2021, Finance Active joined Altus Group, a leading provider of asset and fund information for commercial real estate.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The
 **Associate Analyst** 
 , within the
 **Customer Success** 
 division of Finance Active, is responsible for the integration and monitoring of financial data, as well as supporting public and private clients in France and internationally. This role involves managing large volumes of financial data — including €800 billion in outstanding debt — by entering, updating, and analysing financial information throughout the life of client contracts. The position requires expertise in interest rate management, strong writing skills, and the ability to work effectively with a diverse client base.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Integrate client loan, swap, option, and guarantee contracts into internal systems.
* Analyse financial information provided to ensure accurate data entry.
* Regularly update financial data related to contracts, new agreements, and restructurings.
* Manage client files efficiently to ensure ongoing satisfaction.
* Provide personalised support to clients throughout the process.
* Collaborate with internal teams to enhance data management processes.
* Ensure adherence to processing deadlines and maintain high data quality standards.
* Conduct financial monitoring to anticipate market developments.
* Produce clear and concise reports to support client decision\\-making.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of data processing tools and methods.


**Key Skills**
* Master’s degree (Bac \\+5\\) in Finance or a related field.
* 0–2 years of experience in finance, business, economics, or a related discipline.
* Bilingual \\- English \\& French.
* Intermediate to advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite: Word, Outlook, Excel (V\\-Lookup, Pivot Tables, etc.).
* Initial experience in interest rate and/or debt management, ideally within public institutions, trading floors, or consulting firms.
* Strong understanding of interest rates, debt management, and financial instruments (loans, swaps, options, guarantees).
* Ability to process complex financial data with accuracy and attention to detail.
* Strong written communication skills, capable of producing clear and client\\-oriented reports.
* Educational mindset and ease in interacting with a diverse range of clients.


**Résumé du poste**
 L'Associate Analyst, au sein du pôle Customer Success de Finance Active, est responsable de l'intégration, du suivi des données financières, et de l'accompagnement des clients publics et privés, français et internationaux. Il ou elle traite d'importants volumes financiers, notamment 800 milliards d’euros d’encours d’endettement, en assurant la saisie, la mise à jour et l'analyse de données financières tout au long de la vie des contrats. Le poste requiert une expertise en gestion des taux d'intérêts, des compétences en rédaction, et une capacité à travailler efficacement avec des clients diversifiés.
   

  

**Responsabilités Clés**
* Intégrer les contrats d’emprunt, swaps, options, et garanties clients dans les systèmes internes.
* Analyser les informations financières transmises pour une saisie précise des données.
* Mettre à jour régulièrement les données financières liées aux contrats, nouveaux contrats, et réaménagements.
* Gérer efficacement les dossiers clients pour garantir une satisfaction continue.
* Fournir un accompagnement personnalisé aux clients tout au long du processus.
* Collaborer avec les équipes internes pour améliorer les processus de gestion de données.
* Assurer le respect des délais de traitement et la qualité des données intégrées.
* Effectuer une veille prospective financière pour anticiper les évolutions du marché.
* Développer des rapports clairs et concis pour aider les clients dans leur prise de décision.
* Participer à l'amélioration continue des outils et méthodes de traitement de données.


**Compétences clés**
* Diplôme de niveau Master (Bac\\+5\\) en Finance ou dans un domaine connexe.
* 0\\-2 d'années d'expérience dans la finance, business, économies ou un autre domaine relatif.
* Bilingue – Anglais et Français.
* Compétence intermédiaire à avancée dans la suite Microsoft Office : Word, Outlook, Excel (V\\-Lookup, Pivot Table ou tableaux croisés dynamiques, etc.)
* Première expérience en gestion des taux et/ou de la dette, idéalement au sein de collectivités, de salles de marchés ou de cabinets de conseil.
* Maîtrise des taux d'intérêts, de la gestion de la dette et des produits financiers (emprunts, swaps, options, garanties).
* Capacité à traiter des données financières complexes avec rigueur et précision.
* Aptitude à rédiger des rapports clairs, concis, et adaptés aux besoins des clients.
* Sens pédagogique et aisance dans les interactions avec une clientèle diversifiée.


**What Altus Group Offers**
* Rewarding performance: We are pleased to be able to provide employees competitive compensation, incentive and bonus plans, and a total rewards package that prioritizes their mental, physical and overall financial health.
* Growth and development: As a destination for top industry talent, we’re investing in you to meet the evolving needs of our clients and deliver on your professional goals. Our Altus Intelligence Academy offers over 150,000 hours of learning materials catering to diverse stages of an employee’s career journey.
* Flexible work model: We’re modernizing our employee programs to reflect the new world of work. Our Activity\\-Based Work model provides you with flexibility to align your work location to the work being performed \\- office for connecting and collaborating, and remote for focused work.


 Altus Group is committed to fostering an inclusive work environment where all clients and employees feel welcomed, accepted and valued. We provide an atmosphere free from barriers to promote diversity, equity, and inclusion, and encourage equal opportunities for all employees. We’re seeking candidates with diverse experiences and provide accessible candidate experiences throughout the selection process. If you need accommodation, please contact us at accessibility@altusgroup.com or \\+1 888 692 7487\\.
   

  

 We appreciate all applicants who take the time to apply to Altus Group. Please note that only those who are selected to move forward in the process will be contacted. Thank you.
